nl.inl.blacklab.search.lucene

Class BLSpans

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.search.spans.Spans
      • nl.inl.blacklab.search.lucene.SpansAbstract
        • nl.inl.blacklab.search.lucene.BLSpans
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BLSpansWrapper, PerDocumentSortedSpans, SpansAndNot, SpansDocLevelAnd, SpansFiltered, SpansUnique

    public abstract class BLSpans
extends SpansAbstract
    Will be the base class for all our own Spans classes. Is able to give extra guarantuees about the hits in this Spans object, such as if every hit is equal in length, if there may be duplicates, etc. This information will help us optimize certain operations, such as sequence queries, in certain cases. The default implementation is appropriate for Spans classes that return only single-term hits.

    • Method Detail

      • hitsEndPointSorted

        public boolean hitsEndPointSorted()
        When hit B follows hit A, is it guaranteed that B.end >= A.end? Also, if A.end == B.end, is B.start > A.start?
        Returns:
        true if this is guaranteed, false if not

      • hitsStartPointSorted

        public boolean hitsStartPointSorted()
        When hit B follows hit A, is it guaranteed that B.start >= A.start? Also, if A.start == B.start, is B.end > A.end?
        Returns:
        true if this is guaranteed, false if not

      • hitsAllSameLength

        public boolean hitsAllSameLength()
        Are all hits the same number of tokens long?
        Returns:
        true if this is guaranteed, false if not

      • hitsLength

        public int hitsLength()
        If all hits are the same number of tokens long, how long?
        Returns:
        the length if all hits are guaranteed to be the same length and that length is known, or a negative number otherwise.

      • hitsHaveUniqueStart

        public boolean hitsHaveUniqueStart()
        Is it guaranteed that no two hits have the same start position?
        Returns:
        true if this is guaranteed, false if not

      • hitsHaveUniqueEnd

        public boolean hitsHaveUniqueEnd()
        Is it guaranteed that no two hits have the same end position?
        Returns:
        true if this is guaranteed, false if not

      • hitsAreUnique

        public boolean hitsAreUnique()
        Is it guaranteed that no two hits have the same start and end position?
        Returns:
        true if this is guaranteed, false if not

      • getHit

        public Hit getHit()
        Makes a new Hit object from the document id, start and end positions. Subclasses that already have a Hit object available should override this and return the existing Hit object, to avoid excessive Hit instantiations.
        Returns:
        the Hit object for the current hit
